greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: List of pairs: first pair is (1,1); then follow (x,y) with (x+2y, x+y).
comment: Sequence of x: A078057(n); sequence of y: A000129(n). - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 19 2009
List of pairs (a, b) such that (a, b*sqrt(2)) = (1 + sqrt(2))^n. In the commutative ring Z[sqrt(2)], the set { +/- (1 + sqrt(2)^n} is a multiplicative group. - _Michel Lagneau_, Nov 27 2015
The fractions a(2*n-1)/a(2*n) are successive convergents of the simple continued fraction of sqrt(2). - _Alexander Fraebel_, Sep 03 2020
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,0,1).
formula: a(n) = 2*a(n-2) + a(n-4) for n > 4. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 19 2009
program: a155046_list = concat $ transpose [tail a001333_list, tail a000129_list]
results.author: _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 19 2009
ext: First term in two pairs corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 19 2009
